metadata.title: CVE-2018-12327 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - negligible.
metadata.description: Stack-based buffer overflow in ntpq and ntpdc of NTP version 4.2.8p11 allows an attacker to achieve code execution or escalate to higher privileges via a long string as the argument for an IPv4 or IPv6 command-line parameter. NOTE: It is unclear whether there are any common situations in which ntpq or ntpdc is used with a command line from an untrusted source.

criterions.comment: ntp package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu3').
